intro: Donella sambiranensis, commonly known as the Madagascar bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. It has hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
